items.label: cor-total-perturbation
items.title: Total Perturbation Bound (ρ-Dependent)
items.content:
1654: :label: cor-total-perturbation
1655: 
1656: The total perturbative contribution to the Stratonovich drift of $V_{\text{total}}$ satisfies:
1657: 
1658: $$
1659: A_{\text{perturb}}(S) \le \epsilon_F K_F(\rho) (V_{\text{total}}(S) + 1) + C_{\text{diff,0}}(\rho) + C_{\text{diff,1}}(\rho) V_{\text{total}}(S)
1660: 
1661: $$
1662: 
1663: where **all constants are ρ-dependent**:
1664: - The adaptive force contributes $O(\epsilon_F V_{\text{total}})$ with coefficient $K_F(\rho)$ (Lemma {prf:ref}`lem-adaptive-force-bounded`)
1665: - The viscous force contributes a negative (stabilizing) term $\le 0$ (Lemma [](#lem-viscous-dissipative))
1666: - The adaptive diffusion contributes $C_{\text{diff,0}}(\rho) + C_{\text{diff,1}}(\rho) V_{\text{total}}$ (Lemma [](#lem-diffusion-bounded)), where the diffusion tensor depends on $H(\rho) = \nabla^2 V_{\text{fit}}[f_k, \rho]$
1667: 
1668: Combining these and absorbing constants:
1669: 
1670: $$
1671: A_{\text{perturb}}(S) \le (\epsilon_F K_F(\rho) + C_{\text{diff,1}}(\rho)) V_{\text{total}}(S) + (\epsilon_F K_F(\rho) + C_{\text{diff,0}}(\rho))
1672: 
1673: $$
1674: 
1675: **ρ-Dependence Interpretation:**
1676: - All perturbation bounds depend on ρ through the localized fitness potential $V_{\text{fit}}[f_k, \rho]$
1677: - For any fixed ρ > 0, all bounds are finite
items.raw_directive:
1651: Combining the three lemmas, we obtain the total perturbation bound:
1652: 
1653: :::{prf:corollary} Total Perturbation Bound (ρ-Dependent)
1654: :label: cor-total-perturbation
1655: 
1656: The total perturbative contribution to the Stratonovich drift of $V_{\text{total}}$ satisfies:
1657: 
1658: $$
1659: A_{\text{perturb}}(S) \le \epsilon_F K_F(\rho) (V_{\text{total}}(S) + 1) + C_{\text{diff,0}}(\rho) + C_{\text{diff,1}}(\rho) V_{\text{total}}(S)
1660: 
1661: $$
1662: 
1663: where **all constants are ρ-dependent**:
1664: - The adaptive force contributes $O(\epsilon_F V_{\text{total}})$ with coefficient $K_F(\rho)$ (Lemma {prf:ref}`lem-adaptive-force-bounded`)
1665: - The viscous force contributes a negative (stabilizing) term $\le 0$ (Lemma [](#lem-viscous-dissipative))
1666: - The adaptive diffusion contributes $C_{\text{diff,0}}(\rho) + C_{\text{diff,1}}(\rho) V_{\text{total}}$ (Lemma [](#lem-diffusion-bounded)), where the diffusion tensor depends on $H(\rho) = \nabla^2 V_{\text{fit}}[f_k, \rho]$
1667: 
1668: Combining these and absorbing constants:
1669: 
1670: $$
1671: A_{\text{perturb}}(S) \le (\epsilon_F K_F(\rho) + C_{\text{diff,1}}(\rho)) V_{\text{total}}(S) + (\epsilon_F K_F(\rho) + C_{\text{diff,0}}(\rho))
1672: 
1673: $$
1674: 
1675: **ρ-Dependence Interpretation:**
1676: - All perturbation bounds depend on ρ through the localized fitness potential $V_{\text{fit}}[f_k, \rho]$
1677: - For any fixed ρ > 0, all bounds are finite
1678: - As ρ → ∞, the bounds recover those of the global backbone model

items.label: cor-exp-convergence
items.title: Exponential Convergence
items.content:
1885: :label: cor-exp-convergence
1886: 
1887: Under the conditions of Theorem [](#thm-fl-drift-adaptive), the empirical distribution $\mu_N(t)$ of the adaptive swarm converges exponentially fast to the unique Quasi-Stationary Distribution (QSD) $\pi_{\text{QSD}}$ in the Lyapunov distance:
1888: 
1889: $$
1890: \mathbb{E}[V_{\text{total}}(\mu_N(t))] \le (1 - \kappa_{\text{total}})^t V_{\text{total}}(\mu_N(0)) + \frac{C_{\text{total}}}{\kappa_{\text{total}}}
1891: 
1892: $$

items.label: cor-entropy-convergence-lsi
items.title: Exponential Convergence in Relative Entropy
items.content:
2238: :label: cor-entropy-convergence-lsi
2239: 
2240: By Theorem {prf:ref}`thm-lsi-adaptive-gas`, let $\mu_t$ denote the law of the N-particle system at time $t$, starting from an initial distribution $\mu_0$ with finite entropy. Then:
2241: 
2242: $$
2243: \text{Ent}_{\nu_N^{\text{QSD}}}(\mu_t) \le \text{Ent}_{\nu_N^{\text{QSD}}}(\mu_0) \cdot \exp\left( -\frac{t}{C_{\text{LSI}}} \right)
2244: 
2245: $$
2246: 
2247: where $C_{\text{LSI}}$ is the LSI constant from Theorem `thm-lsi-adaptive-gas`.
items.section: ## 8. The Logarithmic Sobolev Inequality: A Conjectured Strengthening

2235: Now that Theorem {prf:ref}`thm-lsi-adaptive-gas` (N-particle) and Theorem {prf:ref}`thm-lsi-mean-field` (mean-field limit) have been proven, they yield several powerful consequences. We state these as established results.
2236: 
2237: :::{prf:corollary} Exponential Convergence in Relative Entropy
2238: :label: cor-entropy-convergence-lsi
2239: 
2240: By Theorem {prf:ref}`thm-lsi-adaptive-gas`, let $\mu_t$ denote the law of the N-particle system at time $t$, starting from an initial distribution $\mu_0$ with finite entropy. Then:
2241: 
2242: $$
2243: \text{Ent}_{\nu_N^{\text{QSD}}}(\mu_t) \le \text{Ent}_{\nu_N^{\text{QSD}}}(\mu_0) \cdot \exp\left( -\frac{t}{C_{\text{LSI}}} \right)
2244: 
2245: $$
2246: 
2247: where $C_{\text{LSI}}$ is the LSI constant from Theorem `thm-lsi-adaptive-gas`.

items.label: cor-geometric-ergodicity-lsi
items.title: Geometric Ergodicity via LSI
items.content:
2273: :label: cor-geometric-ergodicity-lsi
2274: 
2275: By Theorem {prf:ref}`thm-lsi-adaptive-gas`, exponential convergence in relative entropy implies geometric ergodicity. Specifically, by Pinsker's inequality:
2276: 
2277: $$
2278: \|\mu_t - \nu_N^{\text{QSD}}\|_{\text{TV}} \le \sqrt{2 \, \text{Ent}_{\nu_N^{\text{QSD}}}(\mu_t)}
2279: 
2280: $$
2281: 
2282: Combining with Corollary {prf:ref}`cor-entropy-convergence-lsi`:
2283: 
2284: $$
2285: \|\mu_t - \nu_N^{\text{QSD}}\|_{\text{TV}} \le \sqrt{2 \, \text{Ent}_{\nu_N^{\text{QSD}}}(\mu_0)} \cdot \exp\left( -\frac{t}{2C_{\text{LSI}}} \right)
2286: 
2287: $$

items.label: cor-axioms-verified
items.title: Verification of Axioms 3.2.1 and 3.2.3
items.content:
3531: :label: cor-axioms-verified
3532: 
3533: **1. Axiom of Bounded Adaptive Force (Axiom 3.2.1):** By Theorem {prf:ref}`thm-c1-regularity`, the adaptive force $\mathbf{F}_{\text{adapt}} = \epsilon_F \nabla V_{\text{fit}}[f_k, \rho]$ satisfies:
3534: 
3535: $$
3536: \|\mathbf{F}_{\text{adapt}}(x_i, S)\| \le \epsilon_F F_{\text{adapt,max}}(\rho) < \infty
3537: 
3538: $$
3539: 
3540: for all swarm states $S$ and all $i \in \{1, \ldots, N\}$. This bound is N-uniform and depends only on ρ and the problem parameters.
3541: 
3542: **2. Axiom of Uniform Ellipticity (Axiom 3.2.3):** By Theorem {prf:ref}`thm-c2-regularity`, the Hessian $H_i(S) = \nabla^2 V_{\text{fit}}[f_k, \rho](x_i)$ satisfies:
3543: 
3544: $$
3545: \|H_i(S)\| \le H_{\max}(\rho) < \infty
3546: 
3547: $$
3548: 
3549: Therefore, the regularized metric $G_{\text{reg}} = (H + \epsilon_\Sigma I)^{-1}$ has eigenvalues bounded by:
3550: 
3551: $$
3552: \frac{1}{H_{\max}(\rho) + \epsilon_\Sigma} \le \lambda_{\min}(G_{\text{reg}}) \le \lambda_{\max}(G_{\text{reg}}) \le \frac{1}{\epsilon_\Sigma}
3553: 
3554: $$
3555: 
3556: establishing uniform ellipticity with ρ-dependent lower bound $c_{\min}(\rho) = 1/(H_{\max}(\rho) + \epsilon_\Sigma)$.
